unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Enhancing Quality Control for 'Make in India'**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Enhancing Quality Control for 'Make in India'**

unnormalised: Quality control is becoming increasingly crucial for Indian manufacturers aiming for global competitiveness under the 'Make in India' initiative. Effective QC ensures customer satisfaction and reduces costly recalls. A recent workshop at IIT-Delhi on 10/10/2024 highlighted the importance of statistical process control (SPC) and root cause analysis.
normalised: Quality control is becoming increasingly crucial for Indian manufacturers aiming for global competitiveness under the 'Make in India' initiative. Effective Q C ensures customer satisfaction and reduces costly recalls. A recent workshop at I I T-Delhi on tenth October two thousand and twenty four highlighted the importance of statistical process control (S P C) and root cause analysis.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a leading expert from ISRO, emphasized during the 14:00 hrs session that consistent quality requires rigorous testing at every stage, from raw material procurement (e.g., TATA Steel supplies) to final product dispatch. He cited the example of the Mars Orbiter Mission, where stringent QC was paramount. Regular audits, like those conducted by the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS), are also essential.

unnormalised: Implementing ISO 9001 standards is another key aspect. A new QC training program will commence on 25/12/2024 in Chennai, targeting SME manufacturers in the region. Proper QC not only boosts exports but also strengthens the domestic market. Neglecting quality can lead to losses amounting to several Rs. Lakhs.
